abstract.p: Letter from Alan Metrick, communications director of Natural Resources Defense Council, says Leonardo Dicaprio's serving as chairman of Earth Day 2000 will help raise awareness about environmental issues (Apr 15 Gregg Easterbrook Op-Ed article)

block.p: Gregg Easterbrook's April 15 Op-Ed article is the latest complaint about Leonardo DiCaprio's interview with President Clinton. But Mr. DiCaprio never pretended to be a journalist. He is what he is: a serious young man worried about the future of our planet. Why is his concern a bad thing?

Gregg Easterbrook's April 15 Op-Ed article is the latest complaint about Leonardo DiCaprio's interview with President Clinton. But Mr. DiCaprio never pretended to be a journalist. He is what he is: a serious young man worried about the future of our planet. Why is his concern a bad thing?

We are delighted that Mr. DiCaprio is chairman of Earth Day 2000, an event we hope will put the focus on America's energy profligacy and climate changes caused by greenhouse gases. In raising such issues, Mr. DiCaprio is picking up slack for a news corps that underreports global warming or relies on industryfinanced junk research to ''balance'' warnings of credible scientists.
He can also raise awareness among those who don't remember gas shortages and have never heard of passive solar energy.
ALAN METRICK Director of Communications Natural Resources Defense Council New York, April 17, 2000
